snippet: Consumer prices fell in March for the first time in four months and factory output slipped, while home building increased.
abstract: Labor Department reports that consumer prices fell in March for the first time in four months and factory output slipped, strengthening the Federal Reserve Board argument to maintain its stimulus to encourage economic growth.
lead_paragraph: Consumer prices fell in March for the first time in four months and factory output slipped, while home building increased.

headline.seo: Weakening Seen in Economic Growth Data
headline.main: Economic Growth Is Seen as Weakening
headline.print_headline: Economic Growth Is Seen as Weakening
